content: He, everyone. I'm trying to set up two parallel organizations within the same instance, one for general use and one for our internal dev team. I've got zulip.company.com and zulip-dev.company.com both set up with DNS pointing to the same server, and with SSL certs configured through certbot, but whenever I attempt to access the latter instance, I'm getting an error 400.
Nginx seems to be acting as a reverse proxy for the Zulip daemon, so I'm at a loss as to what's going on. I have the 'zulip-dev' subdomain declared in settings.py.
But now I have an invalid realm that I need to remove.
How can I delete a deactivated realm entirely?
@Joshua Spatz https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/export-and-import.html#deleting-and-re-importing talks about how to permanently delete an organization.
